home.title: Youth Qualification Association
home.subtitle: AQJ
home.description: The AQJ, founded on Saturday, May 25, 2013; is a platform born from the desire to convergence of the different young people of the city of Béni-Mellal, on which; we have was able to develop a participatory approach based on close work, by ensuring the mobilisation of the multiple parties involved in the management of business and issues related to young people.

detail.paragraph1: The Youth Neighborhoods Association (AQJ) is a Moroccan non-profit organization, committed since [year of foundation] to the development, inclusion, and active participation of young people in social, economic, and cultural life. Led by youth for youth, our association acts as a catalyst for talent, solidarity, and responsible citizenship.
detail.paragraph2: To support, train, and mobilize youth around meaningful projects in order to strengthen their ability to take action and engage in the sustainable development of their communities.

about.title: Youth Qualification Association (AQJ)
about.identityText1: Founded on May 25, 2013, AQJ is a Moroccan youth platform born from the convergence of local aspirations of young men and women from Béni-Mellal. Our mission: "An associative youth; created by youth and for youth."
about.identityText2: We develop a participatory and progressive approach based on close collaboration with youth, ensuring their active participation along with that of various stakeholders involved in youth issues.
about.territoryText: The association mainly operates in the Béni-Mellal/Khénifra region, but can carry out activities at the national level when opportunities arise.
objectivesList: Embed the principles of citizenship, democracy, and volunteerism
Raise awareness of civil, economic, social, and cultural rights
Support youth participation in public affairs
Strengthen youth capacities for better integration

actions.title: Our Completed Actions
actions.subtitle: Discover our past actions and their impact
